Pre-Game Insights: South Africa are coming off a record 229-run win over England while Bangladesh have lost their last three matches.

The Proteas bounced back with a great performance after their shock loss to the Netherlands while Bangladesh will be desperate to avoid four straight defeats which will almost certainly end their semi-final chances.
South Africa scored 399 runs at this ground in their last match so the pitch is an absolute belter for batsmen.
The team winning the toss will look to bat first, set a formidable total and then put the pressure on the opposition.
The Proteas lost the only match in which they chased in the tournament, so both teams will be keen to set a score.
The obvious strength of the Proteas is their batting lineup with three of their top five batsmen already scoring a century in the tournament.
Quinton de Kock and Heinrich Klaasen feature prominently in the top run scorer charts as they have reached three figures on two occasions.
Bangladesh will be looking to Captain Shakib Al Hasan to end his poor form with the bat.
South Africa are third on the log but have the best net run rate thanks to big wins over Australia and England.
The all-round quality of the Proteas batting and bowling will overpower the Bangladesh team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa and Bangladesh have previously played each other 24 times in ODI matches. Of these 24 games, South Africa have won 18 whereas Bangladesh have come out victorious on 6 occasions.
